result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin D Sigl in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charges are dismissed and read into 15CF996.

Defendant Benjamin D Sigl in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney McMahon advises the Court the Defendant is still on the waiting list for the drug treatment Court.  The plea hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 remains as set.
Plea hearing at 02-15-2016 02:00 pm
Hearing at 12-16-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Benjamin D Sigl in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court addresses the negative WCS report.  Attorney McMahon advises the Court the Defendant is in the process of enrolling in treatment.  The State is not requesting any additional cash bail but is requesting the Court set the matter for a bail review in two weeks.  The Defendant is still on a wait list for Drug Treatment Court and should be admitted in approximately two weeks.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
